abstract.p: Cinar Corp, maker of animated films, dismisses founders, Micheline Charest and Ronald A Weinberg; photo (S)

block.p: The husband and wife who founded the Cinar Corporation, a maker of animated films, have been dismissed but have refused to resign their board seats, as requested by a special committee of the board. Micheline Charest, left, and Ronald A. Weinberg were dismissed from their senior executive jobs on Thursday, although they had not been working since March, when it was disclosed that $122 million was missing from the Montreal company, best known for the Emmy award-winning ''Arthur'' children's television series. The two control 63 percent of the company's shares.
